articles.headline: F.B.I. Director Speaks Out on Race and Police Bias
articles.snippet: James B. Comey’s remarks at Georgetown University went beyond those of his predecessors, President Obama and Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr.
articles.abstract: James B. Comey’s remarks at Georgetown University went beyond those of his predecessors, President Obama and Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, delivered an unusually candid speech on Thursday about the difficult relationship between the police and African-Americans, saying that officers who work in neighborhoods where blacks commit crimes at a high rate develop a cynicism that shades their attitudes about race.

articles.headline: Disney Tackles Succession, This Time Without Drama
articles.snippet: Robert Iger’s selection of the next chief executive at Disney seems to be made. Or could there be a surprise sleeper candidate?
articles.abstract: Robert Iger’s selection of the next chief executive at Disney seems to be made. Or could there be a surprise sleeper candidate?
articles.lead_paragraph: To the growing list of Robert Iger’s accomplishments during his near-decade tenure as Disney’s chief executive, add succession planning.

articles.headline: U.S. Is Escalating a Secretive War in Afghanistan
articles.snippet: After retrieving a laptop in a strike on a Qaeda leader, American and Afghan commandos increased secret night raids on militants, even as the U.S. has declared the Afghanistan war essentially over.
articles.abstract: After retrieving a laptop in a strike on a Qaeda leader, American and Afghan commandos increased secret night raids on militants, even as the U.S. has declared the Afghanistan war essentially over.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As an October chill fell on the mountain passes that separate the militant havens in Afghanistan and Pakistan, a small team of Afghan intelligence commandos and American Special Operations forces descended on a village where they believed a leader of Al Qaeda was hiding.
articles.byline: By Matthew Rosenberg and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Debate sobre el biocombustible: ¿reducirá el carbono quemar árboles y cosechas?
articles.snippet: Muchos gobiernos buscan incorporar la bioenergía a sus combustibles de transportación. Sin embargo, hay un gran problema con esta estrategia.
articles.abstract: Muchos gobiernos buscan incorporar la bioenergía a sus combustibles de transportación. Sin embargo, hay un gran problema con esta estrategia.

articles.headline: Private Eye Is Said to Face Prosecution in a Hacking
articles.snippet: A private investigator in New York is expected to plead guilty to paying a so-called hacker-for-hire firm to steal email passwords and credentials.
articles.abstract: A private investigator in New York is expected to plead guilty to paying a so-called hacker-for-hire firm to steal email passwords and credentials.
articles.lead_paragraph: Private investigators may be the newest front for federal prosecutors in cracking down on the hacker-for-hire business.

articles.headline: Paris Aims to Embrace Its Estranged Suburbs
articles.snippet: As the city looks to expand its population and remedy inequities, France must confront a history of racism that pushed unwanted people out of central Paris.
articles.abstract: As the city looks to expand its population and remedy inequities, France must confront a history of racism that pushed unwanted people out of central Paris.
articles.lead_paragraph: GRIGNY, France — Paris is about to get bigger, much bigger. Next year, assuming plans move ahead, the city and a ring of inner suburbs will be joined, in an effort to redress a century’s worth of urban decisions that have exacerbated the country’s gaping cultural divide.

articles.headline: Greek Debt Standoff Awaits a Decisive Move
articles.snippet: All sides in the negotiations on Greek debt are firm in the belief that the others will blink first.
articles.abstract: All sides in the negotiations on Greek debt are firm in the belief that the others will blink first.
articles.lead_paragraph: Clad in snug black pants and his signature untucked shirt, the Greek finance minister, Yanis Varoufakis, sauntered into a conference room in the Berlin headquarters of the German finance ministry.
articles.byline: By Landon Thomas Jr. and Jack Ewing

articles.headline: Universal Pictures Regains a Bit of Its Old Sheen
articles.snippet: Universal has quietly put together a 2015 slate that brings an echo of the studio’s 1980s glory days, one that analysts say could make Universal the year’s No. 1 studio, at least by ticket sales.
articles.abstract: Universal has quietly put together a 2015 slate that brings an echo of the studio’s 1980s glory days, one that analysts say could make Universal the year’s No. 1 studio, at least by ticket sales.
articles.lead_paragraph: UNIVERSAL CITY, Calif. — Lobbed between four owners over the last 15 years, Universal Pictures has lately had a reputation in Hollywood as a reliable also-ran.

articles.headline: David Carr, Times Critic and Champion of Media, Dies at 58
articles.snippet: Mr. Carr, a shrewd and well-informed skeptic, wriggled away from the demon of drug addiction to become an unlikely name-brand media columnist at The New York Times.
articles.abstract: Mr. Carr, a shrewd and well-informed skeptic, wriggled away from the demon of drug addiction to become an unlikely name-brand media columnist at The New York Times.
articles.lead_paragraph: David Carr, who wriggled away from the demon of drug addiction to become a journalistic celebrity, a name-brand media columnist at The New York Times and a best-selling author who reported on his own near demise and recovery, died on Thursday in Manhattan. He was 58.
articles.byline: By Bruce Weber and Ashley Southall

articles.headline: Troubled Guardrail Maker Goes on a Lobbying Blitz
articles.snippet: Trinity Industries turns to state attorneys general in an attempt to refute claims that its system has a deadly design flaw.
articles.abstract: Trinity Industries turns to state attorneys general in an attempt to refute claims that its system has a deadly design flaw.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Four Seasons Hotel on the Las Vegas Strip is known for its steakhouse, its palm tree-decorated rooftop pool bar and its quick access to the sprawling gambling floors at the Mandalay Bay casino, just downstairs.
articles.byline: By Eric Lipton and Danielle Ivory

articles.headline: Monopoly’s Inventor: The Progressive Who Didn’t Pass ‘Go’
articles.snippet: Elizabeth Magie, a crusader against big business, devised the classic capitalist game decades before the man credited with its creation.
articles.abstract: Elizabeth Magie, a crusader against big business, devised the classic capitalist game decades before the man credited with its creation.
articles.lead_paragraph: For generations, the story of Monopoly’s Depression-era origins delighted fans almost as much as the board game itself.

articles.headline: CCTV, China’s Propaganda Tool, Finds Itself at Center of Antigraft Drive
articles.snippet: An inquiry into corruption at CCTV has shaken up the nation’s most influential news organization, with reports involving a seamy mix of celebrities, sex and bribery.
articles.abstract: An inquiry into corruption at CCTV has shaken up the nation’s most influential news organization, with reports involving a seamy mix of celebrities, sex and bribery.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — As President Xi Jinping accelerated his sweeping campaign against government corruption, political enemies and Western influences in China, he deployed the Communist Party’s most powerful propaganda tool, the state television network, like a hammer.
